intro: Neosasamorpha iwatekensis, commonly known as the Iwatekensia, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
